captions.text:
<i>You can trust your car</i>
<i>to the system with the star.</i>

Hi, friends.
Goldie Wilson III for Wilson
hover conversion systems.

<i>You know, when my grandpa</i>
<i>was mayor of Hill Valley,</i>

he had to worry
about traffic problems,

but now you don't have
to worry about traffic.

<i>So come on down and see me,</i>
<i>Goldie Wilson III,</i>

<i>at any one of our</i>
<i>29 convenient locations.</i>

title: Back to the Future Part 2 (2/12) Movie CLIP - Hill Valley, 2015 (1989) HD

comments.author: hellokitty kiitt

comments.text:
Here is my check list so far for 2015 comparison
*0:18 That one guy's hair seems to be what we have now. The colors of those 
cloths however, too colorful for our today.
*0:22 We see flying cars, however we still rely on airplanes.
*0:26 We see even flying police cars, none in our today unless you want to 
count drones. Also cars in this today have a computer mouse-esque look to 
them, none common place today.
*0:36 In a general view of the city in this today, there are lots of people 
without the dependent need of a smartphone, hmmmm.
*0:52 That red car is still too far "futuristic looking" in actual today 
standards.
*1:00 Don't get me started on this one, gas stations haven't changed since 
this movie came out. But they still used gas and oil? I guess we got that 
right.
*1:08 3D has improved far better, but still depending on special glasses, 
in this today it's true 4D with no glasses needed. This is outside and 
cinemas have trouble making 3D a mainstream and seamless thing.
*1:22 Well, we sorta got that right with holograms performing at concerts, 
but in this today, they have them outside.
*1:30 haha Traffic is still a major issue.
*1:38 Well, at least they still depict mailboxes, since we still use 
physical mail in our lives.
*1:42 Flying Cars, if they even are a thing of our today, wouldn't cost 
about $40,000 in a debut, unless our currency got deflated all of the 
sudden.
Also the price is $39,999,9 *5*, in this today, we can assume they got rid 
of the penny, but yeah in our today.............
*1:46 Okay, we got that right obviously, but the way the shop there 
displays it's stuff is off. I was suspecting glass cases over them or 
behind counters.
Overall, Our 2015 seems primitive and haven't changed since the 80s 
compared to this 2015.﻿

comments.text:
+TheEmpowered787 They actually did not think 2015 would be like it is in 
the film. They stated that rather than trying to make scientifically sound 
predictions that would probably end up being wrong anyway, they made it 
funny.Despite this, and despite the typical "Where are our hoverboards? 
Where are our flying cars? You don't have much time left, scientists!" if 
you examine closely we do have a lot of the technology they displayed.
